1803.verse-arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ الر ۚ تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْكِتَابِ وَقُرْآنٍ مُّبِينٍ
1803.verse-english: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the verses of the Book and a clear Qur'an.

clauses-english.clause: These are the verses of the Book and a clear Qur'an.

1804.verse-arabic: رُّبَمَا يَوَدُّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَوْ كَانُوا مُسْلِمِينَ
1804.verse-english: Perhaps those who disbelieve will wish that they had been Muslims.

clauses-arabic.clause: رُّبَمَا يَوَدُّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَوْ كَانُوا مُسْلِمِينَ

clauses-english.clause: Perhaps those who disbelieve will wish that they had been Muslims.

1805.verse-arabic: ذَرْهُمْ يَأْكُلُوا وَيَتَمَتَّعُوا وَيُلْهِهِمُ الْأَمَلُ ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
1805.verse-english: Let them eat and enjoy themselves and be diverted by [false] hope, for they are going to know.

clauses-english.clause: Let them eat and enjoy themselves and be diverted by [false] hope,
for they are going to know.

1806.verse-arabic: وَمَا أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا وَلَهَا كِتَابٌ مَّعْلُومٌ
1806.verse-english: And We did not destroy any city but that for it was a known decree.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَمَا أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا وَلَهَا كِتَابٌ مَّعْلُومٌ

clauses-english.clause: And We did not destroy any city but that for it was a known decree.

1807.verse-arabic: مَّا تَسْبِقُ مِنْ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَهَا وَمَا يَسْتَأْخِرُونَ
1807.verse-english: No nation will precede its term, nor will they remain thereafter.

clauses-english.clause: No nation will precede its term,

1808.verse-arabic: وَقَالُوا يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِي نُزِّلَ عَلَيْهِ الذِّكْرُ إِنَّكَ لَمَجْنُونٌ
1808.verse-english: And they say, "O you upon whom the message has been sent down, indeed you are mad.

clauses-english.clause: "O you upon whom the message has been sent down,

1809.verse-arabic: لَّوْ مَا تَأْتِينَا بِالْمَلَائِكَةِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
1809.verse-english: Why do you not bring us the angels, if you should be among the truthful?"

clauses-english.clause: Why do you not bring us the angels,
if you should be among the truthful?

1810.verse-arabic: مَا نُنَزِّلُ الْمَلَائِكَةَ إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ وَمَا كَانُوا إِذًا مُّنظَرِينَ
1810.verse-english: We do not send down the angels except with truth; and the disbelievers would not then be reprieved.

clauses-english.clause: We do not send down the angels except with truth;
and the disbelievers would not then be reprieved.

1811.verse-arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا الذِّكْرَ وَإِنَّا لَهُ لَحَافِظُونَ
1811.verse-english: Indeed, it is We who sent down the Qur'an and indeed, We will be its guardian.

clauses-english.clause: it is We who sent down the Qur'an and indeed,

1812.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ فِي شِيَعِ الْأَوَّلِينَ
1812.verse-english: And We had certainly sent [messengers] before you, [O Muhammad], among the sects of the former peoples.

clauses-english.clause: And We had certainly sent [messengers] before you,
among the sects of the former peoples.

1813.verse-arabic: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
1813.verse-english: And no messenger would come to them except that they ridiculed him.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ

clauses-english.clause: And no messenger would come to them except that they ridiculed him.

1814.verse-english: Thus do We insert denial into the hearts of the criminals.

clauses-english.clause: Thus do We insert denial into the hearts of the criminals.

1815.verse-arabic: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِ ۖ وَقَدْ خَلَتْ سُنَّةُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
1815.verse-english: They will not believe in it, while there has already occurred the precedent of the former peoples.

clauses-english.clause: They will not believe in it,
while there has already occurred the precedent of the former peoples.

1816.verse-arabic: وَلَوْ فَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِم بَابًا مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ فَظَلُّوا فِيهِ يَعْرُجُونَ
1816.verse-english: And [even] if We opened to them a gate from the heaven and they continued therein to ascend,

clauses-arabic.clause: وَلَوْ فَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِم بَابًا مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ فَظَلُّوا فِيهِ يَعْرُجُونَ

clauses-english.clause: And [even] if We opened to them a gate from the heaven and they continued therein to ascend,

1817.verse-arabic: لَقَالُوا إِنَّمَا سُكِّرَتْ أَبْصَارُنَا بَلْ نَحْنُ قَوْمٌ مَّسْحُورُونَ
1817.verse-english: They would say, "Our eyes have only been dazzled. Rather, we are a people affected by magic."

clauses-english.clause: we are a people affected by magic.

1818.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَعَلْنَا فِي السَّمَاءِ بُرُوجًا وَزَيَّنَّاهَا لِلنَّاظِرِينَ
1818.verse-english: And We have placed within the heaven great stars and have beautified it for the observers.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَلَقَدْ جَعَلْنَا فِي السَّمَاءِ بُرُوجًا وَزَيَّنَّاهَا لِلنَّاظِرِينَ

clauses-english.clause: And We have placed within the heaven great stars and have beautified it for the observers.

1819.verse-english: And We have protected it from every devil expelled [from the mercy of Allah]

clauses-english.clause: And We have protected it from every devil expelled [from the mercy of God]

1820.verse-arabic: إِلَّا مَنِ اسْتَرَقَ السَّمْعَ فَأَتْبَعَهُ شِهَابٌ مُّبِينٌ
1820.verse-english: Except one who steals a hearing and is pursued by a clear burning flame.

clauses-arabic.clause: إِلَّا مَنِ اسْتَرَقَ السَّمْعَ فَأَتْبَعَهُ شِهَابٌ مُّبِينٌ

clauses-english.clause: Except one who steals a hearing and is pursued by a clear burning flame.

1821.verse-arabic: وَالْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَاهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ وَأَنبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ مَّوْزُونٍ
1821.verse-english: And the earth - We have spread it and cast therein firmly set mountains and caused to grow therein [something] of every well-balanced thing.

clauses-english.clause: We have spread it and cast therein firmly set mountains and caused to grow therein [something] of every well-

1822.verse-arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا لَكُمْ فِيهَا مَعَايِشَ وَمَن لَّسْتُمْ لَهُ بِرَازِقِينَ
1822.verse-english: And We have made for you therein means of living and [for] those for whom you are not providers.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَجَعَلْنَا لَكُمْ فِيهَا مَعَايِشَ وَمَن لَّسْتُمْ لَهُ بِرَازِقِينَ

clauses-english.clause: And We have made for you therein means of living and [for] those for whom you are not providers.

1823.verse-arabic: وَإِن مِّن شَيْءٍ إِلَّا عِندَنَا خَزَائِنُهُ وَمَا نُنَزِّلُهُ إِلَّا بِقَدَرٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
1823.verse-english: And there is not a thing but that with Us are its depositories, and We do not send it down except according to a known measure.

clauses-english.clause: And there is not a thing but that with Us are its depositories,
and We do not send it down except according to a known measure.

1824.verse-arabic: وَأَرْسَلْنَا الرِّيَاحَ لَوَاقِحَ فَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَأَسْقَيْنَاكُمُوهُ وَمَا أَنتُمْ لَهُ بِخَازِنِينَ
1824.verse-english: And We have sent the fertilizing winds and sent down water from the sky and given you drink from it. And you are not its retainers.

clauses-english.clause: And We have sent the fertilizing winds and sent down water from the sky and given you drink from it.
And you are not its retainers.

1825.verse-arabic: وَإِنَّا لَنَحْنُ نُحْيِي وَنُمِيتُ وَنَحْنُ الْوَارِثُونَ
1825.verse-english: And indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and We are the Inheritor.

clauses-english.clause: it is We who give life and cause death,

1826.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْنَا الْمُسْتَقْدِمِينَ مِنكُمْ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْنَا الْمُسْتَأْخِرِينَ
1826.verse-english: And We have already known the preceding [generations] among you, and We have already known the later [ones to come].

clauses-english.clause: And We have already known the preceding [generations] among you,
and We have already known the later [ones to come].

1827.verse-arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُ حَكِيمٌ عَلِيمٌ
1827.verse-english: And indeed, your Lord will gather them; indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.

1828.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنسَانَ مِن صَلْصَالٍ مِّنْ حَمَإٍ مَّسْنُونٍ
1828.verse-english: And We did certainly create man out of clay from an altered black mud.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنسَانَ مِن صَلْصَالٍ مِّنْ حَمَإٍ مَّسْنُونٍ

clauses-english.clause: And We did certainly create man out of clay from an altered black mud.

1829.verse-arabic: وَالْجَانَّ خَلَقْنَاهُ مِن قَبْلُ مِن نَّارِ السَّمُومِ
1829.verse-english: And the jinn We created before from scorching fire.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَالْجَانَّ خَلَقْنَاهُ مِن قَبْلُ مِن نَّارِ السَّمُومِ

clauses-english.clause: And the jinn We created before from scorching fire.

1830.verse-arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ إِنِّي خَالِقٌ بَشَرًا مِّن صَلْصَالٍ مِّنْ حَمَإٍ مَّسْنُونٍ
1830.verse-english: And [mention, O Muhammad], when your Lord said to the angels, "I will create a human being out of clay from an altered black mud.

clauses-english.clause: when your Lord said to the angels,
"I will create a human being out of clay from an altered black mud.

1831.verse-arabic: فَإِذَا سَوَّيْتُهُ وَنَفَخْتُ فِيهِ مِن رُّوحِي فَقَعُوا لَهُ سَاجِدِينَ
1831.verse-english: And when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul, then fall down to him in prostration."

clauses-english.clause: And when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul,
then fall down to him in prostration.

1832.verse-english: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely,

1833.verse-arabic: إِلَّا إِبْلِيسَ أَبَىٰ أَن يَكُونَ مَعَ السَّاجِدِينَ
1833.verse-english: Except Iblees, he refused to be with those who prostrated.

clauses-english.clause: he refused to be with those who prostrated.

1834.verse-arabic: قَالَ يَا إِبْلِيسُ مَا لَكَ أَلَّا تَكُونَ مَعَ السَّاجِدِينَ
1834.verse-english: [Allah] said, O Iblees, what is [the matter] with you that you are not with those who prostrate?"

clauses-english.clause: what is [the matter] with you that you are not with those who prostrate?

1835.verse-arabic: قَالَ لَمْ أَكُن لِّأَسْجُدَ لِبَشَرٍ خَلَقْتَهُ مِن صَلْصَالٍ مِّنْ حَمَإٍ مَّسْنُونٍ
1835.verse-english: He said, "Never would I prostrate to a human whom You created out of clay from an altered black mud."

clauses-english.clause: "Never would I prostrate to a human whom You created out of clay from an altered black mud.

1836.verse-english: [Allah] said, "Then get out of it, for indeed, you are expelled.

1837.verse-arabic: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكَ اللَّعْنَةَ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الدِّينِ
1837.verse-english: And indeed, upon you is the curse until the Day of Recompense."

clauses-english.clause: upon you is the curse until the Day of Recompense.

1838.verse-arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرْنِي إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
1838.verse-english: He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."

clauses-english.clause: then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected.

1839.verse-english: [Allah] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved

1840.verse-english: Until the Day of the time well-known."

clauses-english.clause: Until the Day of the time well-

1841.verse-arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ بِمَا أَغْوَيْتَنِي لَأُزَيِّنَنَّ لَهُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَأُغْوِيَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
1841.verse-english: [Iblees] said, "My Lord, because You have put me in error, I will surely make [disobedience] attractive to them on earth, and I will mislead them all

clauses-english.clause: because You have put me in error,
I will surely make [disobedience] attractive to them on earth,
and I will mislead them all

1842.verse-english: Except, among them, Your chosen servants."

1843.verse-english: [Allah] said, "This is a path [of return] to Me [that is] straight.

clauses-english.clause: "This is a path [of return] to Me [that is] straight.

1844.verse-arabic: إِنَّ عِبَادِي لَيْسَ لَكَ عَلَيْهِمْ سُلْطَانٌ إِلَّا مَنِ اتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ الْغَاوِينَ
1844.verse-english: Indeed, My servants - no authority will you have over them, except those who follow you of the deviators.

clauses-english.clause: no authority will you have over them,
except those who follow you of the deviators.

1845.verse-english: And indeed, Hell is the promised place for them all.

clauses-english.clause: Hell is the promised place for them all.

1846.verse-arabic: لَهَا سَبْعَةُ أَبْوَابٍ لِّكُلِّ بَابٍ مِّنْهُمْ جُزْءٌ مَّقْسُومٌ
1846.verse-english: It has seven gates; for every gate is of them a portion designated."

clauses-english.clause: for every gate is of them a portion designated.

1847.verse-english: Indeed, the righteous will be within gardens and springs.

clauses-english.clause: the righteous will be within gardens and springs.

1848.verse-english: [Having been told], "Enter it in peace, safe [and secure]."

1849.verse-arabic: وَنَزَعْنَا مَا فِي صُدُورِهِم مِّنْ غِلٍّ إِخْوَانًا عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مُّتَقَابِلِينَ
1849.verse-english: And We will remove whatever is in their breasts of resentment, [so they will be] brothers, on thrones facing each other.

clauses-english.clause: And We will remove whatever is in their breasts of resentment,

1850.verse-arabic: لَا يَمَسُّهُمْ فِيهَا نَصَبٌ وَمَا هُم مِّنْهَا بِمُخْرَجِينَ
1850.verse-english: No fatigue will touch them therein, nor from it will they [ever] be removed.

clauses-english.clause: No fatigue will touch them therein,
nor from it will they [ever] be removed.

1851.verse-arabic: ۞ نَبِّئْ عِبَادِي أَنِّي أَنَا الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ
1851.verse-english: [O Muhammad], inform My servants that it is I who am the Forgiving, the Merciful.

clauses-english.clause: inform My servants that it is I who am the Forgiving,

1852.verse-english: And that it is My punishment which is the painful punishment.

clauses-english.clause: And that it is My punishment which is the painful punishment.

1853.verse-english: And inform them about the guests of Abraham,

clauses-english.clause: And inform them about the guests of Abraham,

1854.verse-arabic: إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا سَلَامًا قَالَ إِنَّا مِنكُمْ وَجِلُونَ
1854.verse-english: When they entered upon him and said, "Peace." [Abraham] said, "Indeed, we are fearful of you."

clauses-english.clause: When they entered upon him and said,

1855.verse-arabic: قَالُوا لَا تَوْجَلْ إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلَامٍ عَلِيمٍ
1855.verse-english: [The angels] said, "Fear not. Indeed, we give you good tidings of a learned boy."

clauses-english.clause: we give you good tidings of a learned boy.

1856.verse-arabic: قَالَ أَبَشَّرْتُمُونِي عَلَىٰ أَن مَّسَّنِيَ الْكِبَرُ فَبِمَ تُبَشِّرُونَ
1856.verse-english: He said, "Have you given me good tidings although old age has come upon me? Then of what [wonder] do you inform?"

clauses-english.clause: "Have you given me good tidings although old age has come upon me?
Then of what [wonder] do you inform?

1857.verse-arabic: قَالُوا بَشَّرْنَاكَ بِالْحَقِّ فَلَا تَكُن مِّنَ الْقَانِطِينَ
1857.verse-english: They said, "We have given you good tidings in truth, so do not be of the despairing."

clauses-english.clause: "We have given you good tidings in truth,
so do not be of the despairing.

1858.verse-arabic: قَالَ وَمَن يَقْنَطُ مِن رَّحْمَةِ رَبِّهِ إِلَّا الضَّالُّونَ
1858.verse-english: He said, "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord except for those astray?"

clauses-english.clause: "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord except for those astray?

1859.verse-english: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"

1860.verse-arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّا أُرْسِلْنَا إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ مُّجْرِمِينَ
1860.verse-english: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals,

clauses-english.clause: we have been sent to a people of criminals,

1861.verse-arabic: إِلَّا آلَ لُوطٍ إِنَّا لَمُنَجُّوهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
1861.verse-english: Except the family of Lot; indeed, we will save them all

1862.verse-arabic: إِلَّا امْرَأَتَهُ قَدَّرْنَا ۙ إِنَّهَا لَمِنَ الْغَابِرِينَ
1862.verse-english: Except his wife." Allah decreed that she is of those who remain behind.

clauses-english.clause: " God decreed that she is of those who remain behind.

1863.verse-english: And when the messengers came to the family of Lot,

clauses-english.clause: And when the messengers came to the family of Lot,

1864.verse-english: He said, "Indeed, you are people unknown."

1865.verse-arabic: قَالُوا بَلْ جِئْنَاكَ بِمَا كَانُوا فِيهِ يَمْتَرُونَ
1865.verse-english: They said, "But we have come to you with that about which they were disputing,

clauses-english.clause: "But we have come to you with that about which they were disputing,

1866.verse-english: And we have come to you with truth, and indeed, we are truthful.

clauses-english.clause: And we have come to you with truth,

1867.verse-arabic: فَأَسْرِ بِأَهْلِكَ بِقِطْعٍ مِّنَ اللَّيْلِ وَاتَّبِعْ أَدْبَارَهُمْ وَلَا يَلْتَفِتْ مِنكُمْ أَحَدٌ وَامْضُوا حَيْثُ تُؤْمَرُونَ
1867.verse-english: So set out with your family during a portion of the night and follow behind them and let not anyone among you look back and continue on to where you are commanded."

clauses-english.clause: So set out with your family during a portion of the night and follow behind them and let not anyone among you look back and continue on to where you are commanded.

1868.verse-arabic: وَقَضَيْنَا إِلَيْهِ ذَٰلِكَ الْأَمْرَ أَنَّ دَابِرَ هَٰؤُلَاءِ مَقْطُوعٌ مُّصْبِحِينَ
1868.verse-english: And We conveyed to him [the decree] of that matter: that those [sinners] would be eliminated by early morning.

clauses-english.clause: And We conveyed to him [the decree] of that matter:
that those [sinners] would be eliminated by early morning.

1869.verse-english: And the people of the city came rejoicing.

clauses-english.clause: And the people of the city came rejoicing.

1870.verse-arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ ضَيْفِي فَلَا تَفْضَحُونِ
1870.verse-english: [Lot] said, "Indeed, these are my guests, so do not shame me.

1871.verse-english: And fear Allah and do not disgrace me."

clauses-english.clause: And fear God and do not disgrace me.

1872.verse-english: They said, "Have we not forbidden you from [protecting] people?"

clauses-english.clause: "Have we not forbidden you from [protecting] people?

1873.verse-arabic: قَالَ هَٰؤُلَاءِ بَنَاتِي إِن كُنتُمْ فَاعِلِينَ
1873.verse-english: [Lot] said, "These are my daughters - if you would be doers [of lawful marriage]."

clauses-english.clause: if you would be doers [of lawful marriage].

1874.verse-english: By your life, [O Muhammad], indeed they were, in their intoxication, wandering blindly.

1875.verse-english: So the shriek seized them at sunrise.

clauses-english.clause: So the shriek seized them at sunrise.

1876.verse-arabic: فَجَعَلْنَا عَالِيَهَا سَافِلَهَا وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةً مِّن سِجِّيلٍ
1876.verse-english: And We made the highest part [of the city] its lowest and rained upon them stones of hard clay.

clauses-arabic.clause: فَجَعَلْنَا عَالِيَهَا سَافِلَهَا وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةً مِّن سِجِّيلٍ

clauses-english.clause: And We made the highest part [of the city] its lowest and rained upon them stones of hard clay.

1877.verse-english: Indeed in that are signs for those who discern.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed in that are signs for those who discern.

1878.verse-english: And indeed, those cities are [situated] on an established road.

clauses-english.clause: those cities are [situated] on an established road.

1879.verse-english: Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.

1880.verse-english: And the companions of the thicket were [also] wrongdoers.

clauses-english.clause: And the companions of the thicket were [also] wrongdoers.

1881.verse-english: So We took retribution from them, and indeed, both [cities] are on a clear highway.

clauses-english.clause: So We took retribution from them,
both [cities] are on a clear highway.

1882.verse-english: And certainly did the companions of Thamud deny the messengers.

clauses-english.clause: And certainly did the companions of Thamud deny the messengers.

1883.verse-english: And We gave them Our signs, but from them they were turning away.

clauses-english.clause: And We gave them Our signs,
but from them they were turning away.

1884.verse-arabic: وَكَانُوا يَنْحِتُونَ مِنَ الْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا آمِنِينَ
1884.verse-english: And they used to carve from the mountains, houses, feeling secure.

clauses-english.clause: And they used to carve from the mountains,

1885.verse-english: But the shriek seized them at early morning.

clauses-english.clause: But the shriek seized them at early morning.

1886.verse-arabic: فَمَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ
1886.verse-english: So nothing availed them [from] what they used to earn.

clauses-arabic.clause: فَمَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ

clauses-english.clause: So nothing availed them [from] what they used to earn.

1887.verse-arabic: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ ۗ وَإِنَّ السَّاعَةَ لَآتِيَةٌ ۖ فَاصْفَحِ الصَّفْحَ الْجَمِيلَ
1887.verse-english: And We have not created the heavens and earth and that between them except in truth. And indeed, the Hour is coming; so forgive with gracious forgiveness.

clauses-english.clause: And We have not created the heavens and earth and that between them except in truth.

1888.verse-english: Indeed, your Lord - He is the Knowing Creator.

1889.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَاكَ سَبْعًا مِّنَ الْمَثَانِي وَالْقُرْآنَ الْعَظِيمَ
1889.verse-english: And We have certainly given you, [O Muhammad], seven of the often repeated [verses] and the great Qur'an.

clauses-english.clause: And We have certainly given you,
seven of the often repeated [verses] and the great Qur'an.

1890.verse-arabic: لَا تَمُدَّنَّ عَيْنَيْكَ إِلَىٰ مَا مَتَّعْنَا بِهِ أَزْوَاجًا مِّنْهُمْ وَلَا تَحْزَنْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَاخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
1890.verse-english: Do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [certain] categories of the disbelievers, and do not grieve over them. And lower your wing to the believers

clauses-english.clause: Do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [certain] categories of the disbelievers,
and do not grieve over them.
And lower your wing to the believers

1891.verse-english: And say, "Indeed, I am the clear warner" -

1892.verse-english: Just as We had revealed [scriptures] to the separators

clauses-english.clause: Just as We had revealed [scriptures] to the separators

1893.verse-english: Who have made the Qur'an into portions.

clauses-english.clause: Who have made the Qur'an into portions.

1894.verse-english: So by your Lord, We will surely question them all

clauses-english.clause: We will surely question them all

1895.verse-english: About what they used to do.

clauses-english.clause: About what they used to do.

1896.verse-arabic: فَاصْدَعْ بِمَا تُؤْمَرُ وَأَعْرِضْ عَنِ الْمُشْرِكِينَ
1896.verse-english: Then declare what you are commanded and turn away from the polytheists.

clauses-arabic.clause: فَاصْدَعْ بِمَا تُؤْمَرُ وَأَعْرِضْ عَنِ الْمُشْرِكِينَ

clauses-english.clause: Then declare what you are commanded and turn away from the polytheists.

1897.verse-english: Indeed, We are sufficient for you against the mockers

clauses-english.clause: We are sufficient for you against the mockers

1898.verse-arabic: الَّذِينَ يَجْعَلُونَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ ۚ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
1898.verse-english: Who make [equal] with Allah another deity. But they are going to know.

clauses-english.clause: Who make [equal] with God another deity.
But they are going to know.

1899.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ نَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ يَضِيقُ صَدْرُكَ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ
1899.verse-english: And We already know that your breast is constrained by what they say.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَلَقَدْ نَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ يَضِيقُ صَدْرُكَ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ

clauses-english.clause: And We already know that your breast is constrained by what they say.

1900.verse-arabic: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَكُن مِّنَ السَّاجِدِينَ
1900.verse-english: So exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord and be of those who prostrate [to Him].

clauses-arabic.clause: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَكُن مِّنَ السَّاجِدِينَ

clauses-english.clause: So exalt [God] with praise of your Lord and be of those who prostrate [to Him].

1901.verse-english: And worship your Lord until there comes to you the certainty (death).

clauses-english.clause: And worship your Lord until there comes to you the certainty (death).
